article:
'The Devil's Mode' (1989) is the only collection of short stories by the English
author Anthony Burgess.

The stories included are varied in their settings and themes and display
Burgess's characteristic wide range, while touching on such themes as the
private life of Shakespeare, which he speculated on in his novel [[Nothing Like
the Sun: A Story of Shakespeare's Love Life|Nothing Like the Sun]], and the
lives of British expatriates in the Far East, explored by Burgess in his
Malayan trilogy.
categories: Short story collections by Anthony Burgess
